tweets.text:
Emma Howard Boyd, the chair of @EnvAgency, has said her organisation “does not have the resources it needs” to effectively protect the environment, in response to new research which has highlighted a “huge gap” in UK regulatory enforcement capacity.

https://t.co/74iRG0EoIJ

Yes good to see some analysis to explain the capacity gap that exists between rising environmental ambitions & the ability to deliver on that. @NaturalEngland & @EnvAgency ready to do the job, but we need the means https://t.co/bEZkSXnDPm

@EnvAgency @EmmaHowardBoyd @thetimes If rivers are cleaner than 20 years ago as was stated, can one explain this from Sept 2000. 5 year plan was meant to correct the other 8%. Seriously what went wrong.
https://t.co/PirxYFOCVC

Correction due, she ought to have said "the Environment Agency lacks the resources to do the job it was set up to do because since 2010 those resources were stripped away by Government". Let's have some real honesty not pussyfoot talk from @EnvAgency chair. https://t.co/dx6xnWAxy4

@EnvAgency @EmmaHowardBoyd @thetimes I'm so sick of this government Ministry of Truth style blogging.

@CleanIlkley @BBCWomansHour @EmmaHowardBoyd @EnvAgency Thank you for coming on and good luck with your work

tweets.text:
🤦🏻‍♂️Double-think from the EA chair

"The Environment Agency does not have the resources it needs to do these things as effectively as we and the public would like"...

..."there is a robust regulatory framework and the resources to enforce it"

Both these things can't be true Emma! https://t.co/3qK97Xi7cq

After Marchington village suffered flooding we are working alongside the @EnvAgency to mitigate the effects. We are working with landowners higher up in the catchment to store water & #slowtheflow with features like storage pools and #woodydebris https://t.co/fybtF1Jft4

@EnvAgency @EmmaHowardBoyd @thetimes "Our rivers and bathing waters are in a much better state than 20 years ago".

Does someone actually read this stuff?

Let me remind you, in 2016 14% of rivers in England reached 'Good' overall environmental health. 

In 2019? Err? None!

Time to go.

https://t.co/8J3kNikmZL

It's #LondonRiversWeek so here's a short video showcasing the Crane Valley and @CVP_CraneValley   #LRW2020 @harrow_council @Hillingdon @EalingCouncil @LBofHounslow @LBRUT @FriendsRivCrane @WildLondon @HeathrowAirport @ThamesAnglers @thameswater @EnvAgencySE https://t.co/gfF5NYdQZY

Brilliant @Unchecked_UK report shows effects of severe funding cuts at @NaturalEngland & @EnvAgency on enforcement. They need major capital & revenue investment at #SpendingReview to fulfil current functions, let alone deliver the #EnvironmentBill & #ELM.

https://t.co/CCvpt8Gk7O

In partnership with The Water Center at Penn, the @MayorInnovation launched its first-ever Water Affordability Academy this past September.

https://t.co/Wntw4Nm6Kk
@BlackCountryBCN @EnvAgencyMids @SevernUnlocked It’s been there for 160 years
@EnvAgency @EmmaHowardBoyd @thetimes Excusing poor performance with tissue of lies; more interested in getting spin right than improving environment. We’re on to you..

"We constantly innovate to do more with less. But ultimately we will get the environment we pay for. A core part of that is funding the @EnvAgency properly." 

My letter to @thetimes quoted in their article about cuts to UK regulators today. https://t.co/9qGJ8JzWBf

Full text 👇 https://t.co/BNpdhz7Z8a

I have to say that after all of the years I've been involved in senior management, policy, strategy, comms, I don't think I've ever heard anyone so badly briefed as the chair of the @EnvAgency. 

https://t.co/bWoT0e22jP

Look at what members of our #Cramlington based @EnvAgency Field Operation team recently removed upstream from Mitford Dam in #Morpeth. This huge root ball from a fallen tree could’ve easily caused a significant issue if it became lodged in the penstocks #floodrisk #floodaware https://t.co/XGhDpJd9sB

We are working in multiple catchments delivering #naturebasedsolutions through #naturalfloodmanagement. We work with landowners to create storage pools, wetlands & leaky dams which all help to #slowtheflow of water as well as clean it & provide wonderful habitat @EnvAgency https://t.co/7PkzJBXb2A
@Feargal_Sharkey @EnvAgency @EmmaHowardBoyd @thetimes So killing off all those fish, insects and plants makes our rivers better @EmmaHowardBoyd ? https://t.co/l0PbZ7LsyI

I’m asking the public and MPs to back my Bill to clean up Britain’s rivers. You can pledge your support here https://t.co/tJMYUNxy4N #EndSewagePollution, #TogetherForRivers #AnglersAgainstPollution https://t.co/8itRXToMKC

tweets.text: @ashsmith43 @Feargal_Sharkey @EnvAgency @EmmaHowardBoyd @thetimes How did she ever get that job? #AskingForAFriend

@Feargal_Sharkey @Ilkley_BM @EmmaHowardBoyd @EnvAgency @BBCWomansHour If it’s true that government has underfunded @EnvAgency, @EmmaHowardBoyd and @JamesBevanEA should have been loudly holding HMG to account, and resigned on principle if their financial demands weren’t met.
@eabroken2020 @EnvAgency @EmmaHowardBoyd @thetimes Over-staffed? Nope, chronically under-staffed in the required areas. They also need more teeth and a willingness to use them.

@EnvAgency @EmmaHowardBoyd @thetimes I am sorry @EnvAgency @EmmaHowardBoyd @thetimes, but you simply cannot continue with these patent untruths.  It is not true that our rivers are cleaner now that 20 years ago.  No credible scientist would agree with you.
@Feargal_Sharkey @EnvAgency @EmmaHowardBoyd @thetimes I don't think the kids that chuck beer cans into the Hogsmill are also staging a sanitary towel throwing contest.

tweets.text: @janegarvey1 @BBCWomansHour @EmmaHowardBoyd @EnvAgency Thankyou Jane for helping us highlight the plight of our rivers, it was good of you to fit me in. Karen

Our staff have been working with @EnvAgencyMids and @BhamCityCouncil to renaturalise parts of the River Cole, adding curve, creating habitats & improving conditions for fish and invertebrate population movements. It’s part of our vision to improve the river for wildlife & people https://t.co/4xPmOEt3Aa
@DaveThroupEA @EnvAgencyMids @SevernUnlocked Great news, but couldn't a temporary quick solution have been found in the interim?

We’re so happy, our second NATIONAL NATURE RESERVE, well done and thank you to everyone who helped to make this happen @FriendsofSaltwellsNatureReserve @NE_WestMids @canalrivertrust @EnvAgencyMids
 and our amazing volunteers. 
WE DID IT, THANK YOU!!!!! Here's our best bits! https://t.co/UKkbTc2NjZ

We all have a responsibility to ensure our #waste is handled correctly. 

If you pass your waste to someone else to take away for you, you must check they are registered as a waste carrier with the Environment Agency 👉 https://t.co/IzkQHCXIeA 

#wastecrime #dutyofcare https://t.co/jMm8nHiGpJ

#DidYouKnow rainfall can wash dog poo into bathing waters through the surface water drains and streams, even if you're far from the beach?
 
Make sure you bag up your dog's poo and put it in the bin.

#BagItBinIt #BinIt4Beaches #RespectProtectEnjoy https://t.co/gnpjBUl8jX

tweets.text: After receiving reports from a member of the public, two @EnvAgency field operation officers removed tree branches that were blocking part of the River Blyth in Stannington Vale #Northumberland We appreciate all of the helpful information received from local residents #floodaware https://t.co/ggBQbk6VUa

Field operations teams are out across the North West today clearing debris screens to reduce flood risk like here at Bessy Brook in Horwich near #Bolton.  

There's lots of rain around this week, keep following us for all the latest flood risk updates. https://t.co/tJSwpdZb4K
On @BBCWomansHour today- #whpowerlist this year is about Our Planet  : who has the real power to make change? Guests include @EmmaHowardBoyd @envagency and @CleanIlkley

Scientists are now testing sewage samples to detect local #coronavirus outbreaks, even when people don't show symptoms.

This is a valuable step in supporting NHS Test and Trace.

Find out more: https://t.co/JEJxbk0ofA

#CovidSewageTesting @DHSCgovuk @EnvAgency https://t.co/4xdR82CtJo

Working to restore rivers for wildlife and for the future! 
#LRW2020 #LondonRiversWeek @RBKingston https://t.co/ZGU8kSbvOz

webinar! Full report: https://t.co/4IfMrRaD44
 #BuildBackBetter #bluegreenspace #LondonRiversWeek2020

We're holding a virtual public meeting to discuss our plans for new Bishopthorpe flood defences in York, 6.30pm on Wednesday 4 November.

Join us via  zoom  
ID: 812 6062 9756
Password: YorkC1

Ask any questions with Slido (code #YorkC1) before or during the event

#NaturalFloodManagement is a key tool in mitigating the effects of extreme weather. We are working with partners across catchments in the county to #slowtheflow & store water whilst also creating wildlife habitat @EnvAgency @NaturalEngland @StaffordshireCC @SoTCityCouncil https://t.co/7mvhiUCQjp
